Its depressing dark and funny as hell
The story is amazing, the puzzles are well designed and the multiplayer is extremely fun (also workshop support).

At the time of writing, I have played through Portal 2's single player story mode every day for the past 8 days. I did not do this to increase my hours on the game. I did not do this because i wanted a better understanding of the games inner workings or mechanics. I did this for one simple reason. This game is the most fun gaming experience i may have ever had. I previously played this game on XBOX 360 a year or so after release. I hadn't even turned 10 years old at the time so i couldn't appreciate just how solid this game truly is. I bought this game while it was on sale about a month ago as i am slowly chipping away at purchasing all Valve and Id Software games. In the month since i have dedicated over 50 hours of my time to the game, 85% of that time dedicated the incredibly well written and solidly designed story mode. The game also offers the much praised co-op mode (which admittedly i have not completed. My brother is usually busy doing other things and many of my other friends don't even have the game) and community made test chambers which i have also sunk some time into, alongside a simple and intuitive chamber builder. Overall, this game is one of, if not THE best game of the 2010's and i highly recommend it to gamers of any skill level.
